p:
The large peak of Sporormiella spp. spores, followed by their abrupt disappearance, suggests that extinct megafaunal populations were large and robust just prior to the YD onset, after which they abruptly disappeared. This suggests a possible causal connection between the megafaunal extinction and the cosmic-impact event. Records of dung fungi from North America appear more equivocal (e.g., Gill et al.
108 and references therein) with limited regional megafaunal extirpations and possibly even extinctions underway prior to the YD onset.
